content.question: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. "Parce metu,1 Cytherea: manent immota tuorum fata tibi; cernes urbem et promissa Lavini moenia, sublimemque feres ad sidera caeli magnanimum Aenean, neque me sententia vertit." 1metu, dat. 1. Name the speaker.

frqParts.text: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. "Parce metu,1 Cytherea: manent immota tuorum fata tibi; cernes urbem et promissa Lavini moenia, sublimemque feres ad sidera caeli magnanimum Aenean, neque me sententia vertit." 1metu, dat. 1. Name the speaker.
2. What is another name for Cytherea (line 1)?

3. In this passage, the speaker tries to reassure the addressee. Write out and translate the Latin words that contain two of the reassuring remarks that the speaker says. Briefly explain why these remarks are reassuring.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
